description: The National Sleep Research Resource (NSRR) subject identifier links the subject's data and files.

display_name: Raven's Progressive Matrics Test (shortened version): Total score
description: Raven's Progressive Matrics Test is a non-verbal test to measure general intelligence and abstract reasoning.

The total score is calculated based on the sum of the 21 items. Scores of 0 to 21 suggest low anxiety, 22 to 35 suggest moderate anxiety, 36 and above suggest concerning level of anxiety.  [Beck et al.,1988 (PubMed ID: 3204199)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/3204199/)

display_name: Beck Depression Inventory for Youth: Total score
description: The BDI-Y contains 20 statements about thoughts, feelings, and behaviors associated with depressive symptomology within the last 2 weeks. Items are rated from 0 (Never) to 3 (Always). Total score is the sum of all 20 items and categorized as: no depression (<=13), mild depression (14 to 19), moderate depression (20 to 28), and severe depression (>=29). [Beck Youth Inventories (BYI). (2012).](http://www.excellenceforchildandyouth.ca/support-tools/measure-profile?id=335)

Calculated – Individual items are multiple choice of 4-5 point scale.  The sum gives a score ranging from 16 to 86; scores of 41 and below indicate "evening types", scores of 59 and above indicate "morning types", scores between 42-58 indicate "intermediate types". [Horne JA and Ostberg O, 1976 (PubMed ID: 1027738)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/1027738)

[Search for all HOMEQ variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/nfs/variables?search=homeq)

Calculated - Total score based on an 8-item questionnaires ranking likelihood of dozing off [Johns MW 1991 (PubMed ID: 1798888)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/1798888). Scale 0-3 for individual items; 0 to 24 for overall score.

[Search for all ESS variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/nfs/variables?search=epworth)

display_name: The Chronic Sleep Reduction Questionnaire: Total score
description:
Calculated - Individual items have an ordinal three-point response scale (1 to 3), and form a total CSRQ total score ranging from 20 to 60. Higher scores suggest more severe chronic sleep reduction. [Meijer A. M. (2008).(PMID: 19021856)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19021856/)

[Search for all CSRQ variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/nfs/variables?search=csrq)

folder: Sleep Questionnaires/Sleep Habits/Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
display_name:
Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index: Hours of actual sleep at night the past month on weekdays

Original text: During the past month, how many hours of actual sleep did you get at night? (This may be different than the number of hours you spend in bed.)
description:
Item from Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index. [Buysse et. al 1989 (PubMed ID: 2748771)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/2748771/)

External semantic reference: [CDE](https://cde.nlm.nih.gov/deView?tinyId=m1mQgx45sHC)

[Search for all PSQI variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/nfs/variables?search=psqi)

folder: Sleep Questionnaires/Sleep Habits/Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
display_name: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index: Total (Global) Score
description:
Summary score for the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index. [Buysse et. al 1989 (PubMed ID: 2748771)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/2748771/) Seven component scores are derived, from 0 (no difficulty) to 3 (severe difficulty). The global score is the sum of the seven components (0 to 21), while higher scores indicate worse sleep quality.

External semantic reference: [CDE](https://cde.nlm.nih.gov/deView?tinyId=mJRilvX9iSA)

[Search for all PSQI variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/nfs/variables?search=psqi)
